paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: African Americans, predominantly over 60 years of age
patients.phenotype: late-onset restrictive cardiomyopathy, mimicking hypertensive cardiomyopathy

individual_records.phenotype_details: typical echocardiographic findings characteristic of CA
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Echocardiogram revealed that only three (7%) carriers had typical echocardiographic findings characteristic of CA.

individual_records.phenotype_details: typical echocardiographic findings characteristic of CA
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Echocardiogram revealed that only three (7%) carriers had typical echocardiographic findings characteristic of CA.

individual_records.phenotype_details: typical echocardiographic findings characteristic of CA
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Echocardiogram revealed that only three (7%) carriers had typical echocardiographic findings characteristic of CA.

functional_data.summary: The Val122Ile variant is associated with a significantly increased risk of heart failure.

variants.segregation_data: The Val122Ile variant segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is predominantly associated with late-onset restrictive cardiomyopathy.
key_quotes: The Val122Ile variant is the most frequent form of TTR amyloid in the USA and prevalent in 3.4% of African Americans.
A prospective observational Atherosclerosis Risk in Communities study, which analysed 3856 African Americans, reported a low clinical penetrance of the disease.

functional_data.summary: The Thr60Ala variant causes both neurologic and cardiac phenotypes, with symptom onset mainly between 50 and 60 years of age.

variants.additional_notes: The variant has a later onset compared to other variants.
key_quotes: The Thr60Ala variant, the second most frequent form of TTR amyloid in the USA, affects up to 1% of the population of Northwestern Ireland.
The Thr60Ala variant causes both neurologic and cardiac phenotypes, and symptom onset mainly occurs between 50 and 60 years of age.

patients.phenotype: exclusively cardiac phenotype with male predominance

functional_data.summary: The Ile68Leu variant shows exclusively cardiac phenotype with male predominance and age-dependent penetrance.

variants.additional_notes: The variant is endemic in central-northern Italy.
key_quotes: The Ile68Leu variant is endemic in central-northern Italy and shows exclusively cardiac phenotype with male predominance and age-dependent penetrance.

functional_data.summary: Patients with the Leu111Met variant were significantly younger at symptom onset compared to other known cardiac variants.

variants.additional_notes: The variant has only been found in Danish families.
key_quotes: In Denmark, the Leu111Met variant, which shows exclusively cardiac phenotype, has only been found in Danish families.

patients.demographics: endemic regions in Portugal, Brazil, and Japan
patients.phenotype: neurologic phenotype in early-onset cases, cardiac phenotype in late-onset cases

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met variant is the most frequent form of TTR amyloid in Europe and is associated with both neurologic and cardiac phenotypes depending on the population.

variants.additional_notes: The variant has a bimodal distribution of onset age in Japan.
key_quotes: The Val30Met variant, known as transthyretin familial amyloid polyneuropathy (ATTR‐FAP), is the most frequent form of TTR amyloid in Europe and other countries.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant variants in the TTR gene were extracted with detailed penetrance data.
